result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven D. Binns Jr.

records.addlTxt: Transcript from 8/15/2022 plea and sentencing hearing

[MK] cases #21CM206 and #22CF187  called at 10:40am
Defendant Steven D Binns Jr. appears via videoconferencing from Stanley Correctional Institution, in custody. Attorney Steven Luchsinger appears in court.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
The Court finds the video-connection to be sight and sound sufficient.
The Court verifies with Mr. Binns that he understands he has the right to be present in the courtroom for sentencing and he is waiving this right. 
ADA Teuber verifies victim rights compliance. The victim impact statement and restitution-request documents are submitted. 
Constitutional rights reviewed; Elements are recited; plea of  " Guilty " is entered in Case #21CM206; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Case #22CF187.

In Case #21CM206 the Court sentences Mr. Binns to 2  years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 1 year, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 1 year.  This sentence is to commence forthwith, concurrent with any other sentence in being. 
The Court finds that the Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that the Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
The Court gives 0 days credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment 
--to undergo assessment, treatment, or counseling 
--to attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or educational programming
--to maintain absolute sobriety 
--to submit to random drug/alcohol screening as the Agent requires 
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
--to comply with DNA sample provision
--to pay costs, fees, and surcharges 
--to pay restitution as to be determined at a restitution hearing 

The Explanation of Determinate Sentence form is to be mailed to the Defendant at the prison.
On request of Mr. Binns, the Court will allow Mr. Binns to appear by video at the restitution hearing.  
recess 11:07am

NEXT:  Restitution Hearing on September 26th at 3:30pm-- arrangements are to be made for Mr. Binns to appear by video
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 15, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Order to Produce Defendant
Proposed Order to Produce defendant

[MK] cases #21CM206 and #22CF187 called at 3:13pm 
Defendant Steven D. Binns Jr. appeared by videoconference from Stanley Correctional Institution, in custody.  Attorney Steven Luchsinger appears in court. ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
The Court verifies with Mr. Binns that he can see and hear the proceedings through the Zoom video-connection.
Attorney Luchsinger indicates that there is a plea agreement; he requests the scheduling of a plea and sentencing hearing, indicating that it would be most workable for Mr. Binns to appear by video for the hearing. Attorney Luchsinger indicates that he will mail the plea paperwork to Mr. Binns so that it can be signed and returned to Attorney Luchsinger and then filed.  
Mr. Binn indicates that he is asking for the remote-appearance due to quarantine policies in place in the prison. 
recess 3:18pm 

NEXT:  Plea & Sentencing on August 15th at 8:30am- arrangements are to be made for Mr. Binns to appear by videoconference

Pre-trial conference on July 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on July 28, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

[ma] Cases 22CF187 & 21CM206 called at 8:40 AM 
Defendant Steven D. Binns in court, in custody with Attorney Steven John Luchsinger.  Michael C. Witt appears for the State of Wisconsin.

As to Case 22CF187, Waiver of Prelim and Arraignment occur:   
Mr.Binns waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charge and maximum penalties are recited
--plea of "not guilty" entered
--in response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate that they are not requesting speedy trial.
recess: 8:45am  

NEXT:   (1) Pretrial Conference on 7/13/22 at 8:30am   (2) Status Conference on 7/28/22 at 2:30pm via zoom
certified copy to DA office (6/28/22--ma)
Order to Produce

ADDRESS INFO for Steven D. Binns
Current: 100 Corrections Drive, c/o Stanley Correctional Institution, Stanley, WI 54768-6500 United States  (Effective: 06-13-2022)
Prior: PO Box 700, c/o Dodge Correctional Institution, Waupun, WI 53963-0700 United States
certified copy to DA(6/1/22--ma)
to Produce
Steven Luchsinger

[MK] During a Branch I hearing in Mr. Binns' pending case #21CM206 on this date, the Court gave a directive regarding appointment of defense counsel in this case.  This minutes from the case #21CM206 hearing are set forth here: 
case [#21CM206] called at 2:07pm 
Defendant Steven D. Binns appears via videoconferencing from Dodge Correctional Institution, in custody.  Attorney Karl Huebner appears. ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court finds the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 
Attorney Huebner notes the recent initial appearance held in a new Jefferson County case in which it appears that Mr. Binns will qualify for PD representation.  Attorney Huebner raises that the Court consider discharging him as court-appointed counsel, so that Attorney Huebner could instead be appointed as PD counsel in both this case and the new case. 
The Court maintains Attorney Huebner's court-appointment as counsel in this case. As to the felony case [Case #22CF187] the Court indicates that if Mr. Binns does not qualify for Public Defender representation in that felony case, then the Court appoints Attorney Huebner as counsel. Otherwise the PD should make efforts to appoint counsel for Mr. Binns on both cases.
recess 2:19pm
 
NEXT: Status Conference on July 1st at 8:30am (when Mr. Binns' case #22CF187 is already scheduled for preliminary hearing)--JA, Mr. Binns indicated that he anticipates transfer to a different prison facility within the next few weeks
Scheduling Order
Preliminary hearing on July 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Notice of Court Order to Jefferson County Dispatch
--no operation of a motor vehicle without valid drivers license

[ae] case called 11:05 AM Defendant Steven D. Binns appeared by telephone from Dodge Correctional. ADA Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The Defendant verifies that the address and date of birth listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited
Right to counsel is given.  
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint.

The Court requires $1,000 Signature Bond, with conditions:
--no operation of a motor vehicle without valid drivers license 

recess 11:08 am
NEXT: (1) Preliminary Hearing on 7/1/22 at 8:30 am [COC is to notify SPD that Defendant would like representation paperwork sent to him]
